message.content: One of the most significant events that occurred in Nepal in the past 100 years is the abolishment of the monarchy and the establishment of a democratic republic. On May 28, 2008, the Nepalese Constituent Assembly declared Nepal a federal democratic republic, ending the 240-year-old monarchy. This historic event marked a significant shift in the political structure and governance of Nepal, transitioning from a monarchy to a democratic system. It represented a major milestone in the country's history and paved the way for social, political, and constitutional reforms in Nepal.
